title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.4: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SECTOR COORDINATION

description.narrative: WASH Sector Coordination, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and their families benefit from safe drinking water, sanitation and improved hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: WASH Sector Coordination

description.narrative: The WASH Sector (36 active partners, including 6 national organization) , under the leadership of UNICEF and SARC and in partnership with WASH sector partners continued to progressively shift from an urgent humanitarian response to a more resilient, equitable and sustainable delivery of quality WASH services. The WASH Sector reached 4.6 million people (2,270,908 male, 2,300,784 female) through resilience focused interventions, and 2.1 million people (1,049,878 male, 1,068,146 female) through humanitarian ones.As part of COVID-19 WASH IPC measures, the Sector supported the rehabilitation of gender-responsive, user-friendly WASH facilities in 160 schools, benefitting 109,519 students (51,474 girls, 58,045 boys). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
